quote_first: Two million dollars had been delivered to Lindstrom's home on Grace Cove at
quote_last: It had come in large bundles of hundred-dollar bills, packed in two large metal cases, and accompanied by Lucky Knudsen and three additional state troopers.
quote_raw: Two million dollars had been delivered to Lindstrom's home on Grace Cove at seven-twenty P.M. It had come in large bundles of hundred-dollar bills, packed in two large metal cases, and accompanied by Lucky Knudsen and three additional state troopers.
title: Purgatory Ridge
author: William Kent Krueger

quote_first: What is interesting and important is that the caller had some difficulty getting through, either genuine or contrived. As a result we know the operator reported the time of the call:
quote_raw: What is interesting and important is that the caller had some difficulty getting through, either genuine or contrived. As a result we know the operator reported the time of the call: twenty minutes past seven.
title: The Murder Room
author: P.D. James

quote_first: The next Friday he watched to see if they would come again. They did, and at the same times, the woman first, at
quote_raw: The next Friday he watched to see if they would come again. They did, and at the same times, the woman first, at twenty minutes past seven, the boy forty minutes later.
title: The Mistletoe Murder
author: P.D. James

quote_first: I'd love to, but if I went horizontal, it would be all over. I have to stay awake for Sean's call. Grant checked the clock, which told him it was
quote_raw: I'd love to, but if I went horizontal, it would be all over. I have to stay awake for Sean's call. Grant checked the clock, which told him it was 7:20 PM. "He's actually a bit late."
title: The Root of All Evil?
author: Ray Keating

quote_first: Winston lit the burner and set a pan of water to boil. He had brought an envelope full of Victory Coffee and some saccharine tablets. The clock’s hands said
quote_raw: Winston lit the burner and set a pan of water to boil. He had brought an envelope full of Victory Coffee and some saccharine tablets. The clock’s hands said seven-twenty: it was nineteen-twenty really.
author: ="George Orwell"

quote_last: , but I felt no hunger. You'd think I might have wanted to eat something after the day I'd had, but I cringed at the very thought of food. I was short of sleep, my gut was slashed, and my apartment was gutted. There was no room for appetite.
quote_raw: The clock read seven-twenty, but I felt no hunger. You'd think I might have wanted to eat something after the day I'd had, but I cringed at the very thought of food. I was short of sleep, my gut was slashed, and my apartment was gutted. There was no room for appetite.
title: Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World
author: Haruki Murakami

quote_first: The pause, we finally concluded, was to allow the other important people to catch up, those who had arrived at 7:10 waiting for those who had arrived at
quote_raw: The pause, we finally concluded, was to allow the other important people to catch up, those who had arrived at 7:10 waiting for those who had arrived at 7:20.
title: Parkinson's Law or the Pursuit of Progress
author: C. Northcote Parkinson
